title: Panopticon V1 Launch
description:
Panopticon V1: Multi-Agent Orchestration for Claude Code

First public release of the open-source orchestration system.

## Overview

Panopticon is an opinionated multi-agent orchestration system for Claude Code. 
It manages projects, agents, and provides a unified set of skills, commands, 
and integrations that sync to your Claude Code environment.

## PRD Reference
- PRD: /home/eltmon/projects/panopticon/docs/PRD.md
- Linear: MIN-630 (origin)
- GitHub: github.com/eltmon/panopticon-cli

## Implementation Phases

### Core (P1) - Required for V1 Launch

| Phase | Description | PRD Parts |
|-------|-------------|-----------|
| 1 | Core CLI Foundation | Part 8, 9, 14 |
| 2 | Skills System | Part 4 |
| 3 | Commands Migration | Part 9 |
| 4 | Dashboard | Part 11 |
| 5 | Workspace Management | Part 9, 14 |
| 6 | Installation System | Part 14 |
| 7 | npm Publishing | Part 14 |
| 10 | Beads Deep Integration | Part 3 |
| 11 | Health Monitoring | Part 7 |

### Extended (P2) - Post-Launch

| Phase | Description | PRD Parts |
|-------|-------------|-----------|
| 8 | Issue Tracker Integration | Part 10 |
| 9 | Testing & Documentation | Part 12, Appendix B |
| 12 | Context Engineering | Part 2, 5 |
| 13 | Multi-Runtime Architecture | Part 6 |
| 14 | Project Hooks | Part 14 |

## Key Deliverables

- **CLI**: \`pan\` command with init, sync, workspace, health subcommands
- **Skills**: 14+ high-value SKILL.md files
- **Commands**: /work-* and /pan:* slash commands
- **Dashboard**: React web app for agent monitoring
- **Workspaces**: Docker-isolated environments per feature
- **npm Package**: panopticon-cli with provenance

## Success Metrics

1. Single source of truth - All agent tooling in ~/.panopticon/
2. Zero friction sync - \`pan sync\` updates Claude Code instantly
3. Project isolation - Each project has its own workspaces/agents
4. Crash recovery - Beads tracks state, agents can resume
5. Multi-project - Switch between projects seamlessly
6. Cross-platform skills - One SKILL.md works everywhere

## Technology Stack

- Language: TypeScript/Node.js
- CLI: Commander.js
- Dashboard: React + Vite + TailwindCSS
- Backend: Express + Socket.io
- Config: TOML
- State: Beads (Git-backed)
- Containers: Docker + Traefik

title: Phase 10: Beads Deep Integration
description:
Implement deep Beads integration for persistent state and agent tracking.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Agents have hooks for work assignment
- [ ] GUPP principle enforced (work on hook = must run)
- [ ] Agent CVs track performance history
- [ ] Crash recovery via Beads state
- [ ] Agent attribution on all actions

## Tasks

### Hooks as Primary Interface (PRD Part 3)

#### Hook Structure
\`\`\`
~/.panopticon/agents/
├── min-648/
│   ├── hook.json        # Active work item
│   ├── mail/            # Incoming messages
│   └── state.json       # Agent state (crash recovery)
└── min-630/
    └── ...
\`\`\`

#### Hook Operations
- [ ] \`bd hook check <agent>\` - Returns current work item
- [ ] \`bd hook complete <agent>\` - Marks work done, returns next
- [ ] \`bd hook assign <agent> <bead-id>\` - Assigns specific issue
- [ ] Hook is backed by Beads, syncs via git

### GUPP Principle
> "If there is work on your Hook, YOU MUST RUN IT."

- [ ] Agent startup checks hook first
- [ ] If work found, execute immediately (no confirmation)
- [ ] When done, close bead, check for more
- [ ] No work = idle/patrol mode

### Agent Attribution
\`\`\`json
{
  "id": "beads-abc",
  "title": "Implement login flow",
  "created_by": "panopticon/agent-min-648",
  "assignee": "panopticon/agent-min-648",
  "commits": [
    {
      "sha": "abc123",
      "author": "panopticon/agent-min-648 <noreply@panopticon.local>",
      "message": "feat: add login endpoint"
    }
  ],
  "events": [
    { "type": "status_change", "actor": "panopticon/agent-min-648" }
  ]
}
\`\`\`

- [ ] Track created_by on all Beads
- [ ] Track commits with agent author
- [ ] Track events with actor

### Agent CVs (Work History)
\`\`\`bash
bd stats --actor=panopticon/agent-min-648

Agent: panopticon/agent-min-648
─────────────────────────────
Issues completed: 47
Success rate:     94%
Avg time/issue:   23 min
Top capabilities: typescript (28), react (19), testing (15)
\`\`\`

- [ ] Collect metrics on issue completion
- [ ] Track success/failure rates
- [ ] Track capability tags from completed work
- [ ] Store in ~/.panopticon/agents/<id>/cv.json
- [ ] Enable capability-based routing

### Crash Recovery
\`\`\`typescript
interface AgentState {
  id: string;
  currentWork: BeadID | null;
  checkpoint: {
    step: string;          // "running tests"
    progress: number;      // 0.75
    files_modified: string[];
    uncommitted_changes: boolean;
  };
  lastActivity: Date;
}
\`\`\`

- [ ] Persist agent state to state.json
- [ ] On agent restart, read state
- [ ] Resume from checkpoint if work exists
- [ ] Warn about uncommitted changes

### Beads Flow with Panopticon
1. Issue created in Linear → Panopticon sees it
2. Agent spawned → Panopticon creates Bead
3. Agent works → Progress logged via \`bd notes add\`
4. Agent completes → Bead closed, MR link attached
5. Work approved → Bead marked as merged

title: Phase 11: Health Monitoring & Stuck Detection
description: Implement stuck detection and health monitoring (Deacon pattern from Gastown). ## Acceptance Criteria - [ ] Agents monitored every 30 seconds - [ ] Stuck agents (3 failures) auto-recovered - [ ] Cooldown prevents recovery loops - [ ] Health dashboard shows all agent statuses - [ ] \`pan health\` CLI shows overview ## Tasks ### Deacon Pattern (PRD Part 7) Constants: - DefaultPingTimeout = 30 seconds - DefaultConsecutiveFailures = 3 - DefaultCooldown = 5 minutes ### Health Check Flow \`\`\` Every 30s: For each running agent: ├── Send HEALTH_CHECK nudge ├── Wait for response (30s timeout) ├── Response received? │ ├── YES: Reset failure counter │ └── NO: Increment failure counter └── Failures >= 3? ├── YES (not in cooldown): Force kill + respawn └── NO: Continue monitoring \`\`\` ### Agent Health Interface \`\`\`typescript interface AgentHealth { agentId: string; status: "healthy" | "warning" | "stuck" | "dead"; lastActivity: Date; consecutiveFailures: number; lastForceKill?: Date; forceKillCount: number; } \`\`\` ### Health Check Implementation - [ ] Run health check loop every 30 seconds - [ ] Send nudge message to agent via tmux - [ ] Wait for response (file touch or output) - [ ] Track consecutive failures per agent - [ ] Store health state in ~/.panopticon/agents//health.json ### Stuck Detection - [ ] Define "stuck" as 3 consecutive failures - [ ] Log warning at first failure - [ ] Log error at stuck threshold - [ ] Track stuck events for metrics ### Auto-Recovery - [ ] Kill stuck agent (tmux kill-session) - [ ] Record force kill timestamp - [ ] Check for uncommitted changes - [ ] Respawn agent with crash recovery (Beads state) - [ ] Resume work from checkpoint ### Cooldown - [ ] After force kill, 5 minute cooldown - [ ] Skip force kill during cooldown - [ ] Continue monitoring during cooldown - [ ] Alert if stuck again after cooldown ### Health Dashboard Component \`\`\`typescript function AgentHealthBadge({ health }: { health: AgentHealth }) { const colors = { healthy: "green", warning: "yellow", stuck: "orange", dead: "red", }; return ( {health.status} {health.consecutiveFailures > 0 && ( ({health.consecutiveFailures} failures) )} ); } \`\`\` - [ ] Add health badge to agent list - [ ] Add health grid showing all agents - [ ] Show last force kill timestamp - [ ] Show cooldown indicator ### \`pan health\` CLI - [ ] Show health of all agents - [ ] Show dashboard status - [ ] Show Traefik status - [ ] Color-coded output ### Configuration \`\`\`toml [health] ping_timeout = "30s" consecutive_failures = 3 cooldown = "5m" enabled = true \`\`\` ## Files to Create - src/lib/health/monitor.ts - src/lib/health/deacon.ts - src/lib/health/recovery.ts - src/cli/commands/health.ts - src/dashboard/components/HealthBadge.tsx - src/dashboard/components/HealthGrid.tsx ## Reference - PRD Part 7: Stuck Detection and Health Monitoring - PRD Part 7: The Deacon Pattern - PRD Part 7: Automatic Recovery

title: Phase 14: Project Hooks
description:
Implement project lifecycle hooks for automation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Hooks defined in project.toml
- [ ] Hooks run at appropriate lifecycle points
- [ ] Working directory support for hooks
- [ ] Variables substituted in hook commands
- [ ] Hook failures handled appropriately

## Tasks

### Hook Configuration (PRD Part 14)
\`\`\`toml
# .panopticon/project.toml

[hooks]
# Simple form - runs from project root
post_test = "echo 'Tests complete!'"

# Full form - with working directory
[hooks.pre_release]
command = "pnpm vsync"
cwd = "frontend"                    # Relative to project root
description = "Sync version to backend and mobile"

[hooks.post_release]
command = "git push && git push --tags"

[hooks.version_bump]
command = "pnpm version \${VERSION} --no-git-tag-version"
cwd = "frontend"
env = { NODE_ENV = "production" }   # Environment variables
\`\`\`

### Available Hook Points

| Hook | When It Runs | Use Case |
|------|--------------|----------|
| pre_workspace_create | Before workspace created | Validate branch, check prereqs |
| post_workspace_create | After workspace created | Initialize workspace config |
| pre_agent_start | Before agent spawns | Ensure services running |
| post_agent_complete | After agent succeeds | Run tests, notify team |
| on_agent_error | Agent encounters error | Send alert, create issue |
| pre_commit | Before committing | Lint, format, test |
| post_commit | After commit | Push, trigger CI |
| pre_release | Before release | Version sync, changelog |
| post_release | After release | Push tags, deploy, notify |

```typescript
  addComment(issueId: string, body: string): Promise<Comment>;
  
  // State transitions
  transitionIssue(id: string, state: IssueState): Promise<void>;
  
  // Linking
  linkPR(issueId: string, prUrl: string): Promise<void>;
}
```

### Normalized Issue Format
```typescript
interface Issue {
  id: string;           // Tracker-specific ID
  ref: string;          // Human-readable (MIN-630, #42)
  title: string;
  description: string;
  state: "open" | "in_progress" | "closed";
  labels: string[];
  assignee?: string;
  url: string;          // Web URL
  tracker: string;      // Which tracker
  linkedIssues?: string[];  // Cross-tracker links
}
```
